text:
THE UNIVERSITY DF TENNESSEE
DIVISION DF UNIVERSITY EXTENSION
BOX S-450, UNIVERSITY STATION
KNOXVILLE
RADIO AND TELEVISION SERVICES
RADIO STATION WUOT
May 17, 1954
Mr. Frank Schooley
NAEB Radio Programming Committee
The University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois:
Dear Frank:
The communiques anent program possibilities are piling up, so here
are my comments on the offerings so far.
I think the James Sweet letter about the possible Library of Con¬
gress series is very interesting. I suggest we contact him further and
work out some details if that is our function. I assume the Acceptance
Committee will then decide if the series is worthwhile.
The Castell series was quite well received in this area, even
eliciting a few comments on FM which is impressive in this sparse FM
area. The three series outlined by Starlin appear to me to have dis¬
tinct possibilities, inasmuch as the Ivory Tower and Invitation shows
were good for their type. My vote would be to close in on this to the
point of offering some concrete proposal to the Acceptance people.
As for the Chilean school-boy series, I am dubious. Certainly we
would have to hear sorre tapes and know more about the quality before
we could decide. Anyway, hasn’t that been fairly well taken out of the
reluctant hands of this committee?
As you can see by this time, I am perhaps a little vague about the
function of this committee, and espedially in regard to these letters,
I hope you plan a meeting some time, so I can get a little or&eAied to
the work of the oommittee. Let me hear from you sometime.
incerely.
Kedneth D. Weight
Director of Broadcasting
